intro: Ctenophrynium unilaterale, commonly known as the one-sided ctenophrynium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appeal make it a popular choice among gardeners and botanists alike.
